department.dept_long_name: Department of the History of Art and Architecture

course.title: Visual Programs in Early Chinese Art
course.description: The course explores the mechanism of early Chinese design and visual programming. Early visual and textual blueprints and the First Emperor's tomb serve as starting point. A variety of designs-bronze decorations and tomb furnishings-from Shang through Han will be examined in this framework. Bio-technology is the central concern.
